app.description: Manages mods from Modrinth and Curseforge
cmd.help.usage.long:
Help provides help for any command in the application.
Simply type {appName} help [command] for more information.
cmd.help.usage.short: Get help for the any command
cmd.add.short: Add a mod from CurseForge or Modrinth
cmd.remove.flag.dry_run: Print out the files/mods that would have been removed
cmd.add.flag.version: The version to add. Use the Modrinth version number or the exact CurseForge filename
cmd.add.flag.allow_version_fallback: Try lower Minecraft patch versions when no compatible file is found
cmd.add.error.unknown_platform: Unknown platform "{platform}". Please use one of the following: curseforge, modrinth
cmd.add.error.no_file: Could not find a compatible file for {id} on {platform}
cmd.add.tui.unknown_platform:
The platform you entered ({platform}) is not a valid platform.
Would you like to retry with a valid one?
cmd.add.tui.mod_not_found: Mod "{id}" for {platform} does not exist. Would you like to modify your search?
cmd.add.tui.choose_platform: Which platform would you like to use?
cmd.add.tui.enter_project_id: What is the project id of the mod you want to add?
cmd.add.tui.no_file_found: Could not find a file for {name} and the Minecraft version {gameVersion} for {loader} loader. Would you like to try on {other}?
cmd.add.tui.enter_project_id_on: What is the project id of the mod you want to add on {platform}?
cmd.init.tui.game-version.invalid: That Minecraft version does not exist
cmd.init.tui.game-version.question: What exact Minecraft version are you using? (eg: 1.18.2, 1.19, 1.19.1)
cmd.init.tui.loader.question: Which loader would you like to use?
cmd.init.tui.mods-folder.question: Where is your mods folder? (full or relative path from the current directory):
cmd.init.tui.release-types.question: Which types of releases would you like to consider to download?
cmd.init.usage.game-version: What exact Minecraft version are you using? (eg: 1.18.2, 1.19, 1.19.1)
cmd.init.usage.loader:
Which loader do you want to use?
Possible options: {loaders}
cmd.init.usage.mods-folder: Where is your mods folder? (full or relative path from {cwd})
cmd.init.usage.release-types:
Which types of releases would you like to consider to download? (comma-separated list)
Possible options: {releaseTypes}
cmd.install.unsure.hash_mismatch: {name} has a different version locally than what is in the lockfile
cmd.install.unsure.lock_missing: {name} has a local file that isn't in the lockfile.
cmd.install.error.unresolved: Please fix the unresolved issues above manually or by running mmm scan, then try again.
cmd.install.download.hash_mismatch: {name} has hash mismatch, downloading from source
cmd.install.error.mod_not_found: {name}({id}) cannot be found on {platform} anymore. Was the mod revoked?
cmd.install.error.no_file: {platform} doesn't serve the required file for {name}({id}) anymore. Please update it.
cmd.scan.flag.prefer: Preferred platform for lookups (modrinth or curseforge)
cmd.scan.flag.add: Add discovered mods to the config and lock files
cmd.scan.all_managed: ✅ All of your mods are managed by mmm.
cmd.scan.confirm_add: Update modlist.json and modlist-lock.json with these results?
cmd.scan.persist_failed: Could not write an entry for {file}
cmd.scan.persist_skipped_unsure: Not updating configuration files because one or more files could not be verified (unsure).
cmd.update.error.mod_not_found: {name}({id}) cannot be found on {platform} anymore. Was the mod revoked?
cmd.update.error.no_file: {platform} doesn't serve the required file for {name}({id}) anymore. Please update it.
cmd.update.error.missing_lock_entry: {name} doesn't seem to be installed. Please delete the lock file and the mods folder and try again.
cmd.update.error.locked_file_missing: {name} ({path}) doesn't exist. Please delete the lock file and the mods folder and try again.
cmd.update.error.unmanaged_found: Unmanaged mods were detected in your mods folder. Please remove them (or add them to your configuration) and try again.
cmd.test.short: Test if mods have support for a target Minecraft version
cmd.test.success: All mods have support for {version}. You can safely upgrade.
cmd.test.same_version: The target version {version} is the same as your current version.
cmd.test.missing_support_header: Some mods are missing support for {version}.
cmd.test.cannot_upgrade: You cannot upgrade to {version} just yet.
cmd.test.error.invalid_version: {version} is not a valid Minecraft version.
cmd.test.error.latest_unavailable: Could not determine the latest Minecraft version. Please provide an explicit version instead.
